title: time.Parse fails with a single decimal digit
body:
Using the following format string:
"2012-01-02 22:52:44"

I am able to parse decimal values with no issues, unless there is just a single decimal
digit. Ex:
"2012-01-02 22:52:44.5"

That particular case fails. Adding additional numbers after the decimal seems to work
well.

Gist with test cases and output: https://gist.github.com/1d0b0fc496e76735deb3

I'm running this against the go1 release

What steps will reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.
1. http://play.golang.org/p/51i1o5-JFN
2. https://gist.github.com/1d0b0fc496e76735deb3

Which operating system are you using?
OS X

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go version go1
